member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.Core.Functions.FunctionBroker.AskConfirmationAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotConfirmationRequestOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.remarks: The expected flow: 1. FunctionInvoker creates a FunctionBroker before invoking a method. 2. FunctionInvoker obtains a Task from FunctionBroker that will complete when: 3. Implementer calls AskConfirmationAsync inside their method. 4. AskConfirmationAsync registers a Task with the InteractionManager and returns it from AskConfirmationAsync 5. FunctionInvoker registers the function invocation with the broker, then returns false so auto-continue can't complete. 6. User confirms function, which calls InteractionManager which sets the Task from 4. as complete. 7. InteractionManager sets a continuation on the function invoke to continue. 8. Once all function confirmation requests are completed, a new call is made to responder using the new response.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.Core.Logging.DataFormatter
member.summary: Supports formatting various fields for logging purposes, including optional hashing of potentially sensitive information to protect privacy.
member.remarks:
This class implements `IFormatProvider`, so an instance can be passed as the first parameter to `String.Format()`. For example this line: String.Format(new DataFormatter(), "{0:P}", filePath); will use the `DataFormatter` to hash the file path when formatting it.
Use an instance of this class as the format provider for a class that extends `TraceListenerBase` to enable smart formatting of traced data objects.

member.remarks: This static method does NOT use hashing, regardless of any instance setting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.Core.Logging.Privacy
member.summary: Manages a key used to hash sensitive data to ensure privacy.
member.remarks: Once generated (or set by a client), the key is stored in .NET isolated storage, so that it remains consistent across sessions. The key does not need to be stored in a secure vault because it is only used as an HMAC key for hashing the current user's data for tracing and telemetry; the hashed data is then uploaded without the key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CodeMappers.BaseStreamedController.OnReceiveStreamedText(System.String)
member.summary: Processes a chunk of streamed text, and communicates every new line it processes to outside subscribers. It replaces the streamed text line break characters with the target document line break characters, so it essentially normalizes line breaks on the fly.
member.remarks:
In streaming scenarios, it is possible that one chunk ends with a '\r' (carriage return) and the next chunk starts with '\n' (line feed). To address this, when a chunk arrives, any pending '\r' from the previous chunk is first checked:
If the pending '\r' is immediately followed by a '\n' at the start of the new chunk, they are combined into a complete line break.
Otherwise, the pending '\r' is treated as a literal and is appended to the current line.
member.param: The incoming chunk of streamed text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CodeMappers.BaseStreamedController.ProcessLineInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method appends the new line to a queue. If this queue's size exceeds the threshold, it will start processing the lines in the queue up until the queue is of the size of the threshold. Except when the stream has completed. In that case, it will process all the remaining elements in the queue. This is done because we want to be able to provide validation for the bottom lines for line ending normalization and line validation.
member.param: A value indicating whether the stream has completed. It is used to determine things like whether we are currently on the last line, or if we should continue processing until the end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CodeMappers.BaseStreamedController.CountBottomLineEndings(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Text.StringBuilder})
member.summary: Counts the number of line break trailing characters using the bottom lines as space to analyze. It will iterate from the last line to the first line, and count the number of line break characters until it finds a non-line break character.
member.param: The collection of StringBuilder objects to be analyzed for line break characters.
member.returns: The total count of line break characters found in the provided collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CodeMappers.Implementation.CodeMapperProvider
member.summary: This service provides access to CodeMappers and Legacy CodeMappers. CodeMappers are used to Replace or Insert code onto a target document. Legacy CodeMappers will be removed eventually, as they also need to be changed to the new format, but for now I will leave them there as they do provide some functionality for unit tests mappings.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CodeMappers.CodeMappingManager
member.summary: Manages code mapping between source and target programming languages. This will serve as a layer for smart handling of the multiple mappers in conjunction with the diff mapper and enable us to pick the best choice for the situation.

Gets the mapped edits for a given target, and a given copilot content code part. In the background this will use both the language mapper (if any) and the fallback mapper to determine the best action case for the mapping.
member.param: The target mapping.
The code content blocks to map.
Represents the configurable options for the code mapper.
A correlation id to correlate telemetry from the mapper with telemetry from the client.
The cancellation token.
member.returns: The mapped edits.

member.summary: This will attempt to obtain a language mapper.
member.param: The content from copilot.
member.returns: Returns the most appropriate mapper for the situation. If no language mapper is found null will be returned instead.

member.summary: Map Async implementation that uses gpt-4o-mini model.
member.param: The target snapshot.
List of code blocks to map.
The name of the language of the document.
Interaction id
An action that will be triggered every times new edits are discovered by the mapper as the streaming gets in. This action will also be invoked with an empty list of edits when mapping starts.

If the service response return non-successful response.

This is triggered when the response is redacted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ContextEvaluator.batchReduceBans
member.summary: Bans a service from being used for a specific contract.
member.remarks: The reason why this was added is because we don't want to keep on activating a service to check if it is implementing a contract to batch reduce. Having a hash map makes it a bit easier to just check if a service has already failed. If it did, we just leave it out of the list of services to activate and try to batch reduce.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotFilePathConverter
member.summary: Converts file paths between relative and absolute forms based on a workspace base path.
member.remarks: This class supports two usage scenarios. When used as a MEF component, it receives an that supplies the workspace base path. Alternatively, a custom instance can be created by using the method, which accepts a workspace base path as an argument and utilizes an internal . In addition to instance methods for converting file paths, this class provides static methods to directly convert between relative and absolute paths. The static methods include , , and , which normalize paths, compute relative paths, and resolve absolute paths respectively.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotWorkspaceContextProvider
member.summary: This context provider is a placeholder so that we can create and embed it into the current system.
member.remarks: We call it a placeholder because if you look at the current implementation it is actually not doing anything, and it doesn't support returning context as a context provider. This is because the context is already provided by the scope, but a context provider is still required to be registered in the system.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.EditingStateTracking.EditingState
member.summary:
Editing workflow states for snippets that Copilot is suggesting across multiple files. For more detail about these states, see:
not mapped
mapping
mapped
reviewing
inactive review
completed
resetting

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.EditingStateTracking.IFileEditingState
member.summary:
Ephemeral state belonging to both a specific file and response's unmapped edits. Responsibilities include:
Exposing a which transitions through different forms, allowing updates to be subscribed to.
Running code mapping for its edits associated with it, and retaining the resulting s which are anchored to a specific point in time in the document.
Advancing its when notified about specific actions such as
Updating the response in history with whether any changes were accepted. (not currently implemented, see PR 597099)
Currently it is not responsible for these operations, which are handled by an implementation of ICopilotFileListCommandProvider:
Invoking ICopilotSnapshotService to capture the current state of documents.
Applying changes to documents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ServiceBrokerRetryExtensions.DefaultServiceAvailabilityWaitTimes
member.summary: Default timeouts for GetServiceProxyWithRetriesAsync if not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ServiceBrokerRetryExtensions.DefaultWaitBetweenAttemptsOnException
member.summary: Default wait between attempts that threw an exception for GetServiceProxyWithRetriesAsync if not specified.

Obtain a proxy from the service broker with retries and waiting for the service proxy to become available. The caller is responsible for appropriately handling the lifetime of the returned proxy. This should mainly be used in locations where obtaining a service's proxy is critical to functionality over the lifetime of the extension, and impacts more than a single operation. Avoid needing this if possible. It sends one telemetry scope per retry, which will be a lot of noise if called frequently.
member.param: Service broker to use.
Descriptor of the service to get a proxy for.
Cancellation for the entire operation.
Options to use when activating the service.
How many attempts to make if an exception is thrown or delayed activation times out.
How long to wait on each attempt for the service to become available.
How long to wait between attempts if an exception is thrown.
Parent telemetry event to correlate with.
Callback for logging messages. If the boolean is true, the message is for an error. Otherwise it is verbose.
member.exception: Thrown if a proxy could not be obtained.
member.returns: The requested service proxy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.NonFormattableString
member.summary: Work around an overload resolution problem with `FormattableString`, enabling interpolated string to be used with tracing efficiently while also supporting plain strings.
member.remarks:
See Overloaded string methods with string interpolation.
An extra implicit conversion causes the compiler to prefer the overloads that take `FormattableString` when interpolated strings are used with the tracing methods. While plain `string` parameters get converted to/from this struct, the conversions should basically evaporate in inlining.

member.remarks: This scope generates a single item and it will then call all the registered that registered with context type to append the traits to this context. The prompt rendering layer will then render the traits below the workspace traits header, serving as a section with 'additional context' from the project that the trait providers may deem necessary or important for the model. member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Conversations.IDEContext.DebuggerContextTypesProvider.ConvertContextPaths(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.Debugging.DebuggerContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ICopilotPathConverter)
member.summary: This is a hack to allow us to promptify a debugger context whose paths have been converted to relative paths. Reasons to do this: 1. We do not want to store relative paths in the real context as that would break ICopilotContextFiles, which requires real paths. 2. We can not pass an ICopilotPathConverter to the Promptify method in 17.14 as the project references don't allow us to. This is not a problem in dev18.

member.summary: Gets a snapshot if one is already created or generates one without storing.
member.remarks: For the purposes of verification, #file needs a list of the available documents with the snapshot system will already generate. However, we don't want to call store inside it as it may never get released if someone is using the system incorrectly. So we'll lookup a snapshot if it's there (which it should be with proper usage) and if not we'll generate one without saving it.

member.summary: Parses a single glob pattern and tests strings against it.

member.summary: Creates a new Minimatcher instance, parsing the pattern into a regex.

member.summary: Creates a filter function that tests input against a pattern.

member.summary: Tests a single input against a pattern.
member.remarks: This function reparses this input on each invocation. For performance, avoid this function and reuse a Minimatcher instance instead.

member.summary: Filters a list of inputs against a single pattern.
member.remarks: This function reparses this input on each invocation. For performance, avoid this function and reuse a Minimatcher instance instead.

member.summary: Compiles a pattern into a single regular expression.

member.summary: Checks whether a given string matches this pattern.

member.name: M:Minimatch.Minimatcher.Filter(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Filters a list of inputs against this pattern.

member.name: M:Minimatch.Minimatcher.BraceExpand(System.String,Options)
member.summary: Expands all brace ranges in a pattern, returning a sequence containing every possible combination.

member.name: T:Options
member.summary: Contains options that control how Minimatch matches strings.

member.name: P:Options.NoComment
member.summary: Suppresses the behavior of treating # at the start of a pattern as a comment.

member.name: P:Options.NoNegate
member.summary: Suppresses the behavior of treating a leading ! character as negation.

member.name: P:Options.NoBrace
member.summary: Do not expand {a,b} and {1.3} brace sets.

member.name: P:Options.NoGlobStar
member.summary: Disable ** matching against multiple folder names.

member.name: P:Options.NoCase
member.summary: Ignores case differences when matching.

member.name: P:Options.NoExt
member.summary: Disable "extglob" style patterns like +(a|b).

member.name: P:Options.Dot
member.summary: Allow patterns to match filenames starting with a period, even if the pattern does not explicitly have a period in that spot. Note that by default, a/**/b will not match a/.d/b, unless dot is set.

member.name: P:Options.NoNull
member.summary: When a match is not found by Match(), return a list containing the pattern itself. If not set, an empty list is returned if there are no matches.

member.name: P:Options.FlipNegate
member.summary: Returns from negate expressions the same as if they were not negated. (ie, true on a hit, false on a miss).

member.name: P:Options.MatchBase
member.summary: If set, then patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, a?b would match the path /xyz/123/acb, but not /xyz/acb/123.

member.name: P:Options.AllowWindowsPaths
member.summary: If true, backslahes in patterns and paths will be treated as forward slashes. This disables escape characters.

member.name: P:Options.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Ignores case differences when matching. This is the same as NoCase.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute

member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.
